intro: Eremogeton, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees, adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. They are characterized by their small, often showy flowers that may be clustered in dense inflorescences. The leaves are usually succulent, helping the plant conserve water in dry conditions. Eremogeton species are found primarily in regions of Africa, Australia, and the Americas.
